Education

Brunel University
2012-2015

BEng Aerospace Engineering

  • Principles of aircraft design
  • Matlab
  • Flight testing analysis
  • Propulsion systems, aircraft structures and material
In my final year project I worked part of a team of students on the student formula car. I took charge of designing the brake discs as well as air ducts to properly cool them. The previous year the brakes failed due to the high temperatures it reached, therefore I decided on a metal matrix composite that benefited the formula car as well as making sure the cost of replacing the old brake discs were minimal. The brakes were then analysed using a computational fluid dynamics programme assessing whether the brakes were efficient at braking as well as dissipating heat.

Newham Sixth Form College
